item.title: Every Brat Has a Story Podcast #1
item.itunes:author: Military Brats Registry
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with documentary producer Donna Musil
item.itunes:summary: "Where are you from?" is asked of Military Brats and discussed by Donna Musil of Brats Without Borders Productions, producer of the Brat Film "Brats: Our Journey Home".
item.description: "Where are you from?" is asked of Military Brats and discussed by Donna Musil of Brats Without Borders Productions, producer of the Brat Film "Brats: Our Journey Home".

item.title: Every Brat Has a Story Podcast #2
item.itunes:author: Military Brats Registry
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Rudy Maxa, the Savvy Traveler
item.itunes:summary: "Savvy Traveler" Rudy Maxa talks about growing up military and how his experiences around the world eventually led to becoming one of America's best known travel journalists.
item.description: "Savvy Traveler" Rudy Maxa talks about growing up military and how his experiences around the world eventually led to becoming one of America's best known travel journalists.

item.title: Every Brat Has a Story Podcast #3
item.itunes:author: Military Brats Registry
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Mary Edwards Wertsch, author of "Military Brats: Legacies of Childhood Inside the Fortress"
item.itunes:summary: Mary Edwards Wertsch discusses her book, "Military Brats: Legacies of Childhood Inside the Fortress" and the preservation of Military Brat culture and history.

item.title: Every Brat Has a Story Podcast #4
item.itunes:author: Military Brats Registry
item.itunes:subtitle: In Podcast #4 we talk to Gene Moser, Army Brat and Operations Officer for "Operation Footlocker" about the present and future of the organization, and how you can arrange an appearance of the Mobile Military Brat Monument at your reunion or other event.
item.itunes:summary: Gene Moser talks about Operation Footlocker, the "Mobile Military Brat Monument".
item.description: Gene Moser talks about Operation Footlocker, the "Mobile Military Brat Monument".
item.itunes:keywords: military brat military brats overseas schools Army Navy Air Force Marines Coast Guard Opfoot Operation Footlocker

item.title: Every Brat Has a Story Podcast #5
item.itunes:author: Military Brats Registry
item.itunes:summary: In Podcast #5 we talk to Sylvester James Gates, Army Brat and John S. Toll Professor of Physics and Director of the Center for String and Particle Theory at the University of Maryland. Jim gives us a simple explanation of String Particle Theory, and talks about how growing up military shaped his life. We also talk about finding lost friends.
item.description: In Podcast #5 we talk to Sylvester James Gates, Army Brat and John S. Toll Professor of Physics and Director of the Center for String and Particle Theory at the University of Maryland. Jim gives us a simple explanation of String Particle Theory, and talks about how growing up military shaped his life. We also talk about finding lost friends.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jim Gates discusses String Particle Theory and growing up military.
item.itunes:keywords: military brat military brats overseas schools Army Navy Air Force Marines Coast Guard Opfoot Operation Footlocker

item.title: Every Brat Has a Story Podcast #6
item.itunes:author: Military Brats Registry
item.itunes:summary: In Podcast #6 we talk to Future Akins, Air Force Brat and Assistant Professor of Art at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, TX. as well as an active artist. Future sent an email to the Military Brats Registry and wrote, "I would like to ask any Military Brat who is an artist what impact growing up a a brat has had on their art work, positive or negative, neutral or intense." We'll hear Future talk about her life growing up military and how it affected her career as an artist and professor.
item.description: In Podcast #6 we talk to Future Akins, Air Force Brat and Assistant Professor of Art at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, TX. as well as an active artist. Future sent an email to the Military Brats Registry and wrote, "I would like to ask any Military Brat who is an artist what impact growing up a a brat has had on their art work, positive or negative, neutral or intense." We'll hear Future talk about her life growing up military and how it affected her career as an artist and professor.
item.itunes:subtitle: Future Akins talks about how growing up military affected her career in art.

item.title: Every Brat Has a Story Podcast #7
item.itunes:author: Military Brats Registry
item.itunes:subtitle: In Podcast #7 we talk to Arnon Reichers, Air Force Brat who lived in Vietnam in 1963 to 1965. Arnon tells us about some very scary experiences as a dependent in a war zone.
item.itunes:summary: Arnon Reichers tells about her experiences in Vietnam
item.description: Arnon Reichers tells about her experiences in Vietnam

item.itunes:subtitle: Richard Meese, author of "Detour" discusses how growing up military had a strong influence on his writings. We also introduce our new Military Brats Registry Podcast Theme!

item.title: Every Brat Has a Story Podcast #12
item.itunes:author: Military Brats Registry
item.itunes:subtitle: Author Donna Moreau is interviewed about her book, Waiting Wives.
item.itunes:summary: In 1964, an old Air Force base on the plains of Kansas became Schilling Manor--the only base ever to be set aside for the wives and children of soldiers assigned to Vietnam. Author Donna Moreau was the daughter of one such waiting wife and in her book "Waiting Wives, the Story of Schilling Manor, Home front to the Vietnam war Donna investigates an extraordinary group of women.
item.description: In 1964, an old Air Force base on the plains of Kansas became Schilling Manor--the only base ever to be set aside for the wives and children of soldiers assigned to Vietnam. Author Donna Moreau was the daughter of one such waiting wife and in her book "Waiting Wives, the Story of Schilling Manor, Home front to the Vietnam war Donna investigates an extraordinary group of women.
item.itunes:keywords: military brat, military brats, overseas schools, That's The Way They Lived, Army, Navy, Air Force, Marines, Coast Guard, Pioneer Military Loans, Opfoot, Operation Footlocker, Waiting Wives, Donna Moreau

item.title: Every Brat Has a Story Podcast #13
item.itunes:author: Military Brats Registry
item.itunes:subtitle: Author Michael Ritter talks about The Brat Chronicles
item.itunes:summary: In 1972, there were 371,366 dependents of military personnel living overseas. Michael Ritter, '73 graduate of K-town in Germany has recently released his book titled The Brat Chronicles, a reflection of the experiences of these thousands of Americans who fought the good fight, not on the field of battle, but in living rooms of military housing around the world. We also hear from Dan Rockholt and his impressions of the Brat Film. Listen for the special coupon offer in the Brat Store.
item.description: In 1972, there were 371,366 dependents of military personnel living overseas. Michael Ritter, '73 graduate of K-town in Germany has recently released his book titled The Brat Chronicles, a reflection of the experiences of these thousands of Americans who fought the good fight, not on the field of battle, but in living rooms of military housing around the world. We also hear from Dan Rockholt and his impressions of the Brat Film. Listen for the special coupon offer in the Brat Store.
item.itunes:keywords: military brat, military brats, overseas schools, That's The Life They Lived, Army, Navy, Air Force, Marines, Coast Guard, Pioneer Military Loans, Opfoot, Operation Footlocker, Brat Chronicles, Michael Ritter

item.title: Every Brat Has a Story Podcast #14
item.itunes:author: Military Brats Registry
item.itunes:subtitle: Trubee Wetterau talks about the day Pearl Harbor was attacked.
item.itunes:summary: December 7, 1941 is a day that will be remembered forever. On that day, 14 year old Trubee Wetterau lived at Schofield Barracks near Pearl Harbor, Hawaii. In this podcast, Trubee shares her experience as a Military Brat when America was attacked.
item.description: December 7, 1941 is a day that will be remembered forever. On that day, 14 year old Trubee Wetterau lived at Schofield Barracks near Pearl Harbor, Hawaii. In this podcast, Trubee shares her experience as a Military Brat when America was attacked.
item.itunes:keywords: military brat, military brats, overseas schools, That's The Life They Lived, Army, Navy, Air Force, Marines, Coast Guard, Pioneer Military Loans, Opfoot, Operation Footlocker, Pearl Harbor, Trubee Wetterau.

item.title: Every Brat Has a Story Podcast #15
item.itunes:author: Military Brats Registry
item.itunes:subtitle: Escape from Nanking
item.itunes:summary: October 1, 2006 marks the 57th anniversary of the People's Republic of China. Military Brats Edwina, Jim and Cheryl Fortress lived in Nanking, China on the day the Communist government ordered all non-citizens to leave the country. In this interview with Edwina Fortress Mohler we hear of her experiences on that day.
item.description: October 1, 2006 marks the 57th anniversary of the People's Republic of China. Military Brats Edwina, Jim and Cheryl Fortress lived in Nanking, China on the day the Communist government ordered all non-citizens to leave the country. In this interview with Edwina Fortress Mohler we hear of her experiences on that day.
item.itunes:keywords: military brat, military brats, overseas schools, That's The Life They Lived, Army, Navy, Air Force, Marines, Coast Guard, Pioneer Military Loans, Opfoot, Operation Footlocker, China, Nanking, Edwina Fortress Mohler.

item.title: Every Brat Has a Story Podcast #16
item.itunes:author: Military Brats Registry
item.itunes:subtitle: Howard Wong, Nationalist Chinese Air Force Brat.
item.itunes:summary: Recently I had lunch with 76 year old Howard Wong, an Air Force brat. But not the US Air Force...the Chinese Air Force! Howard's father was a general in the Chinese Air Force and worked with the Flying Tigers in World War II. Howard shares some of his own memories of living in Hong Kong and Chengdu China, and we find out how he answers the question "where are you from?"
item.description: Howard Wong was born in Guangzhou, China, in the late 1920s. His father was Lieutenant General Huang Guang Rui of the Nationalist Chinese Air Force. Lt. General Huang Guang Rui served under Sun Zhongshan (Sun Yat-sen), and later under Jiang Jieshi (Chiang Kai-shek). During China's war against the Japanese invaders in the 1930s and 40s, Howard moved around China with his father, mother, and siblings. He lived in Guangzhou, Chengdu, and Hong Kong. His father had good relationships with General James Doolittle and General George C. Marshall. Howard later emigrated to the United States in the late 1940s where he has been ever since.
item.itunes:keywords: military brat, military brats, overseas schools, That's The Life They Lived, Army, Navy, Air Force, Marines, Coast Guard, Pioneer Military Loans, Opfoot, Operation Footlocker, China, Howard Wong, Flying Tigers, Sun Yat Sen, George C Marshall, Jimmy Doolittle

item.title: Every Brat Has a Story Podcast #17
item.itunes:author: Military Brats Registry
item.itunes:subtitle: Gene Connor talks about his efforts to raise funds for the American Cancer Society
item.itunes:summary: With three of his five siblings battling cancer, Military Brat Gene Connor knew he had to do something to help. So he made a commitment to cycle 2,000 miles to raise $10,000 for the American Cancer Society as it pursues its mission to eliminate cancer. In this podcast we'll find out what Military Brats can do to support Gene's efforts to raise money for research to stamp out a disease that nearly everyone's life has been touched by in one way or another.
item.description: With three of his five siblings battling cancer, Military Brat Gene Connor knew he had to do something to help. So he made a commitment to cycle 2,000 miles to raise $10,000 for the American Cancer Society as it pursues its mission to eliminate cancer. In this podcast we'll find out what Military Brats can do to support Gene's efforts to raise money for research to stamp out a disease that nearly everyone's life has been touched by in one way or another.
item.itunes:keywords: military brat, military brats, overseas schools, That's The Life They Lived, Army, Navy, Air Force, Marines, Coast Guard, Pioneer Military Loans, Opfoot, Operation Footlocker, Gene Connor, American Cancer Society
